result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Jury status hearing on August 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on September 7, 2023 at 08:30 am.

1:31 PM Defendant Joshua Ray Pennington appeared by phone.  Attorney Lucas Swank appeared by video for Joshua Ray Pennington.  Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests to set for a one day trial. State agrees. Parties to determine date via email with Judicial Assistant. Bond cont.
New Notice of Hearing generated due to zoom information changed.

Request for Substitution of Judge

Defendant can hear okay, okay appearing by phone, received no threats/promises to appear by phone. Court finds def KVI waives personal appearance. Defense waives court's appearance for purposes of entering plea. Attorney Swank advised defendant waives reading of information and enters NG pleas. PTC set. Request for substitution of Judge.

Def wishes to waive right to PH. Court advised def right to PH. Def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for further proceedings. Information filed. Atty Swank states def waives reading of information and enters NG plea. PTC set. Request for substitution of Judge. Bond to continue.

9:43 AM Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua Ray Pennington appeared by phone.  Attorney Lucas Swank in court for Joshua Ray Pennington. Court advised defendant of rights/max penalties. Defendant waives reading of complaint.
